Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler
public class WolfScheduler extends Object
The WolfScheduler class file reads in and stores as a list all of the Course records stored in a file. Additionally, WolfScheduler creates a schedule for the current user (a student) and provides functionality for naming the schedule, adding a Course to the schedule, removing a Course from the schedule, resetting the schedule
Author:
hchunter

  • Method Details

    • getCourseCatalog

      public String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      Will return the course catalog. If there are no Courses in the catalog, an empty 2D String array is returned.
      Returns:
      a 2d String array of the catalog

    • getScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getScheduledActivities()
      Will return the course schedule with limited information. If there are no courses and empty 2d string array is returned
      Returns:
      a 2D String array of the schedule

    • getFullScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
      Returns the Full Course Schedule with all relevant information
      Returns:
      a 2D string array of the schedule with all the information for each course

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public boolean addCourseToSchedule(String name, String section)
      Will add a course to the schedule array list Method will check to verify the course exists in the catalog, the student is not currently enrolled in the class, and will then attempt to add the course to the schedule.
      Parameters:
      name - - the courses name
      section - - the courses section
      Returns:
      a boolean for if the course was added to the schedule or not
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with the messaged You are already enrolled in [course name] if a duplicate of the you are trying to enroll in is on your schedule

    • removeActivityFromSchedule

      public boolean removeActivityFromSchedule(int idx)
      Will remove a course from the schedule array list Method will check to verify the course exists on the schedule, and will then attempt to remove the course from the schedule.
      Parameters:
      idx - -the index of the activity you want to remove
      Returns:
      -true or false stating rather or not the course was removed from the schedule
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - - will throw exception if schedule does not have an element at the index passed through

    • getCourseFromCatalog

      public Course getCourseFromCatalog(String name, String section)
      Uses a course name, and a course section to search through the catalog for a specific course.
      Parameters:
      name - the courses name
      section - the courses section
      Returns:
      the searched for course from the catalog

    • getScheduleTitle

      public String getScheduleTitle()
      Returns the schedule title
      Returns:
      title

    • exportSchedule

      public void exportSchedule(String fileName)
      Exports the schedule to a file
      Parameters:
      fileName - - the file passed through for input/output
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with message The file cannot be saved if the file cannot be found.

    • setScheduleTitle

      public void setScheduleTitle(String title)
      Will set the title of the schedule
      Parameters:
      title - - the schedules title
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with message Title cannot be null if title is null or an empty string

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      Will reset the ArrayList schedule back to blank

    • addEventToSchedule

      public void addEventToSchedule(String eventTitle, String eventMeetingDays, int eventStartTime, int eventEndTime, String eventDetails)
      Add event is used to add an event onto your schedule.
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - -the title of your event
      eventMeetingDays - -the meeting days of your event
      eventStartTime - -the start time of your event
      eventEndTime - -the end time of your event
      eventDetails - -the details of your event
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - - with the message You have already created an event called [event title] if the event has the same title as another event you have created
